meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of being cut or divided easily.
meanings.sent1: The sectility of the clay allowed the sculptor to shape it effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The sectility of the fabric made it simple to tear into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: The sectility of the cake made it a breeze to slice for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her sectility was like that of a soft butter, easily spread and molded.
meanings.sent5: The sectility of the paper was so high that even a child could tear it with ease.

meanings.definition: The property of being easily separated into parts or segments.
meanings.sent1: The sectility of the puzzle pieces made it fun to put together.
meanings.sent2: The sectility of the fruit allowed for easy peeling and slicing.
meanings.sent3: The sectility of the Lego blocks made building structures a joy.
meanings.sent4: The sectility of the clouds seemed to divide them into fluffy shapes.
meanings.sent5: The sectility of the book's pages made it simple to tear out for a project.
